Events.text: Troops of the Republic of Pisa and the Republic of Florence clash in the Battle of Cascina.
Events.html: Troops of the Republic of Pisa and the Republic of Florence clash in the Battle of Cascina.

Events.text: Thomas Cromwell is executed at the order of Henry VIII of England on charges of treason. Henry marries his fifth wife, Catherine Howard, on the same day.
Events.html: Thomas Cromwell is executed at the order of Henry VIII of England on charges of treason. Henry marries his fifth wife, Catherine Howard, on the same day.

Events.text: La Laguna encomienda, known today as the Laguna province in the Philippines is founded by the Spaniards as one of the oldest encomiendas (provinces) in the country.
Events.html: La Laguna encomienda, known today as the Laguna province in the Philippines is founded by the Spaniards as one of the oldest encomiendas (provinces) in the country.

Events.text: In the Eighty Years' War the Spanish capture the strategic Dutch fortress of Schenkenschans.
Events.html: In the Eighty Years' War the Spanish capture the strategic Dutch fortress of Schenkenschans.

Events.text: Battle of Warsaw begins.
Events.html: Battle of Warsaw begins.

Events.text: Constitution of the province of Cantabria ratified at the Assembly Hall in Bárcena la Puente, Reocín, Spain.
Events.html: Constitution of the province of Cantabria ratified at the Assembly Hall in Bárcena la Puente, Reocín, Spain.

Events.text: French Revolution: Maximilien Robespierre and Louis Antoine de Saint-Just are executed by guillotine in Paris, France.
Events.html: French Revolution: Maximilien Robespierre and Louis Antoine de Saint-Just are executed by guillotine in Paris, France.

Events.text: Mahmud II became Sultan of the Ottoman Empire and Caliph of Islam.
Events.html: Mahmud II became Sultan of the Ottoman Empire and Caliph of Islam.

Events.text: Peninsular War: Battle of Talavera: Sir Arthur Wellesley's British, Portuguese and Spanish army defeats a French force led by Joseph Bonaparte.
Events.html: Peninsular War: Battle of Talavera: Sir Arthur Wellesley's British, Portuguese and Spanish army defeats a French force led by Joseph Bonaparte.

Events.text: José de San Martín declares the independence of Peru from Spain.
Events.html: José de San Martín declares the independence of Peru from Spain.

Events.text: USS Constellation (1854), the last all-sail warship built by the United States Navy, is commissioned.
Events.html: USS Constellation (1854), the last all-sail warship built by the United States Navy, is commissioned.

Events.text: American Civil War: Battle of Ezra Church: Confederate troops make a third unsuccessful attempt to drive Union forces from Atlanta, Georgia.
Events.html: American Civil War: Battle of Ezra Church: Confederate troops make a third unsuccessful attempt to drive Union forces from Atlanta, Georgia.

Events.text: At the age of 18, Vinnie Ream becomes the first and youngest female artist to receive a commission from the United States government for a statue (of Abraham Lincoln).
Events.html: At the age of 18, Vinnie Ream becomes the first and youngest female artist to receive a commission from the United States government for a statue (of Abraham Lincoln).

Events.text: The 14th Amendment to the United States Constitution is certified, establishing African American citizenship and guaranteeing due process of law.
Events.html: The 14th Amendment to the United States Constitution is certified, establishing African American citizenship and guaranteeing due process of law.

links.title: Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution

Events.text: The city of Miami, Florida is incorporated.
Events.html: The city of Miami, Florida is incorporated.

Events.text: In the culmination of the July Crisis, Austria-Hungary declares war on Serbia, igniting World War I.
Events.html: In the culmination of the July Crisis, Austria-Hungary declares war on Serbia, igniting World War I.

Events.text: The United States begins a 19-year occupation of Haiti.
Events.html: The United States begins a 19-year occupation of Haiti.

Events.text: The Silent Parade took place in New York City, in protest to murders, lynchings, and other violence directed towards African Americans.
Events.html: The Silent Parade took place in New York City, in protest to murders, lynchings, and other violence directed towards African Americans.

Events.text: U.S. President Herbert Hoover orders the United States Army to forcibly evict the "Bonus Army" of World War I veterans gathered in Washington, D.C.
Events.html: U.S. President Herbert Hoover orders the United States Army to forcibly evict the "Bonus Army" of World War I veterans gathered in Washington, D.C.

Events.text: First flight of the Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress.
Events.html: First flight of the Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress.

Events.text: Hawaii Clipper disappears between Guam and Manila as the first loss of an airliner in trans-Pacific China Clipper service.
Events.html: Hawaii Clipper disappears between Guam and Manila as the first loss of an airliner in trans-Pacific China Clipper service.

Events.text: The Sutton Hoo helmet is discovered.
Events.html: The Sutton Hoo helmet is discovered.

Events.text: World War II: Soviet leader Joseph Stalin issues Order No. 227. In response to alarming German advances, all those who retreat or otherwise leave their positions without orders to do so are to be tried in a military court, with punishment ranging from duty in a shtrafbat battalion, imprisonment in a Gulag, or execution.
Events.html: World War II: Soviet leader Joseph Stalin issues Order No. 227. In response to alarming German advances, all those who retreat or otherwise leave their positions without orders to do so are to be tried in a military court, with punishment ranging from duty in a shtrafbat battalion, imprisonment in a Gulag, or execution.

Events.text: World War II: Operation Gomorrah: The Royal Air Force bombs Hamburg, Germany causing a firestorm that kills 42,000 German civilians.
Events.html: World War II: Operation Gomorrah: The Royal Air Force bombs Hamburg, Germany causing a firestorm that kills 42,000 German civilians.

links.title: Bombing of Hamburg in World War II

Events.text: A U.S. Army B-25 bomber crashes into the 79th floor of the Empire State Building killing 14 and injuring 26.
Events.html: A U.S. Army B-25 bomber crashes into the 79th floor of the Empire State Building killing 14 and injuring 26.

Events.text: Heavy rain and a mudslide in Isahaya, western Kyushu, Japan, kills 992.
